A house in south Greenville was under investigation after a fire but was ultimately ruled accidental PERIOD

A house fire in south Greenville was ruled accidental after investigators determined the fire which led to the death of one individual was caused by the misuse of smoking materials PERIOD

Greenville FireRescue units EMS  and Engine  were dispatched Saturday night to an unknown medical alarm call located at  Cornwall Court according to a GFR press release PERIOD

According to the press release the first unit to respond to the medical emergency was EMS  who arrived on scene within approximately six minutes after checking enroute to the residential incident at around  p.m PERIOD

When GFR arrived to the scene it tried to make contact with someone inside the residence according to GFRs press release PERIOD When EMS  approached the twostory brick residence it noticed moderate smoke coming from inside the home PERIOD

EMS  returned to the ambulance after realizing the smoke then according to the release put on their safety equipment to make a quick entry into the home PERIOD Engine  was enroute for assistance and arrived on scene shortly after EMS  PERIOD

The release states the officer in charge immediately asked Pitt County  to dispatch a full structure fire alarm PERIOD After an interior search of the home the crew discovered a small fire which was quickly extinguished and located a person who was deceased inside the structure PERIOD

Engine  was enroute to respond to the medical alarm and was able to arrive on scene fairly quickly according to the press release PERIOD

The fire was ruled as accidental due to the misuse of smoking materials upon the completion of a joint investigation with GFR the Greenville Police Department and the medical examiners office according to the press release PERIOD
